body.p: A boxed for offers a visual representation of an iterator statement. For the for loop, the right part of the for displays the iterator variable name. The second row holds an expression representing the collection that will be iterated over. The expression in the in row must resolve to a collection. The last row contains the expression that will process each element of the collection.
The example below is an alternative way of producing list similar as .

fig.title: Iterator expression of Approved credit score agencies

body.note: This feature was introduced as part of the IBM BAMOE 9.1 and DMN 1.5 releases.
